description: Tacos were excellent and the service was super friendly! Also had the horchata and it was delish.
author: Kevin H.

description:
I came here in search of a calm and affordable place to grub in the Marina during the Fleet Week Air Show. The food was excellent -- I ordered a wet chicken burrito and it was MONSTROUS.

My partner ordered a chicken quesadilla and it was definitely decent.

The burrito could easily feed two people with leftovers. The quesadilla might leave you scrummaging through the chip bag afterwards. Between the two, you can easily feed three hungry guys with leftovers.

I was a little floored by the bill. It ended up being $50 for a burrito, quesadilla, chips and guac and three beers.

The guac was really good and a healthy portion as well. I still debate as to whether I would order it again if I were to return.

The beers were out of a bottle --standard fare.

I will say, customer service was excellent, especially for a quick-service grab-n'-go-type restaurant that this is. The gentleman who rang us up checked on us a few times and made sure we had utensils and everything we needed.

All in all, I would come back, though I'd probably ditch the beers and guac because they dirtied the bill and didn't add enough to the experience to justify.
author: Nima A.

description: Nice little spot right outside our hotel (Cow Hollow Inn and Suites). A few tables inside, although a bit cramped, groups would enjoy the closeness. Ordered a burrito and a pork bowl--both good and the price was not too much. Friendly service as well!
author: Enrique C.

description:
If you like fresh, good Mexican food for a great price then you need to check this place out. We were walking back home after an afternoon stroll today and we came upon this place (found on yelp) and I'm so glad we did. 

We were craving Mexican earlier today & this spot definitely footed the bill. It's kind of like a better version of chipotle. They have bowls, burritos, tacos etc... and you can make it fajita style (+$1.25) in which we did and it was delicious. 

The chips salsa/guacamole was also really good as well. They have multiple salsas you can get, as well as other little toppings to add to your dish. Employees were friendly and service was fast!
author: Bethany M.

description:
My wife and I were talking earlier today how we needed to find a good, cheap Mexican restaurant in our neighborhood. We found it here. Not a ton of options but good flavor and very reasonably priced. 

There are only about 2 seats inside and a few tables outside but it wasn't that busy. Seems like a lot of folks come in and get the food to go. We enjoyed sitting outside and splitting a burrito bowl and guacamole and chips. 

This will be our go to spot for some cheap (but tasty) Mexican food! 

If you check in with Yelp, you get a free bag of chips too!
author: Matt M.

description:
My boyfriend ordered the quesadillas with steak while I ordered the Sopes (I think it came with chicken), which was the first time I had the dish. I love corn tortillas so I was impressed the base, which was a thick corn tortilla that was perfectly soft yet toasted. The sauce that it came with hardly had any flavor, but the sopes itself was sufficient without the sauce because the meat was well-seasoned and the shreddings were perfect. I really enjoyed my boyfriend's quesadilla -- it had the perfect amount of cheese and meat, and the meat was perfectly seasoned. We were both definitely craving it the next day and were really glad that we found this little gem of a place near the place that we were staying. 

My only complaints are that it was a cold night and the restaurant was cold inside because there is a big window that was open and the door was wide open. Additionally, the wait was pretty long since they seemed to be caught up preparing a lot of phone orders, so that was also a bit annoying. I would suggest that you call ahead in order to save some time waiting, since everyone else seems to do that.
author: Molly L.

description:
As always, I was lured in by the promise of a freshly-made corn tortilla. But after I got my tacos I realized there is a difference between a freshly made corn tortilla and a HAND-made tortilla. Anyhow, the tortilla itself was thick and too soft - to the point where I could not taste it and it kind of dissolved a bit from the liquid coming from the meat. They have special meats of the day and on Wednesdays it's carnitas. I also got a carne asada and camarones (shrimp) taco. ($3.25 each) The meat quality was great, the carne asada had large chunks of steak that was still a little rare, which I liked a lot. Shrimp and carnitas were made perfectly and well seasoned. 

My boyfriend ordered a carne asada quesadilla, a horchata, and a side of guacamole. He too, said the carne asada was really good. The salsa bar is limited and none of the salsas really stood out to me, they were pretty bland. The guac costs an extra dollar-something and they give it to you in a small container the same size as you would get from the salsa bar. I was disappointed to find that the guacamole was even more bland and very lacking in seasoning compared to other Mexican places I've been to. If you check in on Yelp, you get a free bag of chips but you can tell that the chips are not made in store and probably from a bag. *sigh* 

There is a sign that says there is a secret menu if you go on their website, but we went on the website only to find that neither the items on the menu nor the prices match up (it's now more expensive). I think Toma is an okay place to get Mexican food but like another Yelper said, it's not mind-blowing. It's also very small inside with only one table and a few bar style seats against the wall.
author: Cecille W.

description: While waiting for a dinner reservation I stopped by Toma to try some tacos, because why not?! It smelled so delicious outside I had to go in, we ordered 3 tacos - carne asada, adobado, and mahi mahi. Man these were so good!!! My favorite was definitely the mahi mahi! At almost $4 a taco, it's not the cheapest option in the city, but I got delicious tacos and great service in a nice part of town so I'm not complaining.
author: Jenny E.

description: Best burrito in SF!!! The mild green salsa is full of flavor and the food is FRESH!!!
author: shimmerSF M.

description: Ok " I'm mean let's be real is the Marina known for Mexican food " 3s hermanos is legit " but these guys are convenient, professional, good salsas " but my torta was lack luster "" I will return & try burrito or some tacos
author: Sean K.

description:
I love Mexican spots that offer up organic meat. Toma sources their meats from Golden Gate Company and you can taste the freshness in each bite.

I sampled some of their tacos today and while I enjoyed the thick corn tortilla and the well seasoned Adobado - I don't think I will go out my way to order delivery from them again. 

Their guacamole was fairly tasteless and outside of the delightful tortilla shell - I was not overly impressed with my meal.

If you're looking for fresh organic Mexican food - I recommend sticking to Don Pistos or Nopalito.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
A tad pricey but definitely good eating.

Got asada, adobado (pork) and mahi mahi. All three meats were really good. The tortilla was one of the best (non-traditional semi-thick and floury) I've had.

The tortilla is probably why those who order through a delivery service do not like their meal. I can totally see the tortilla going bad if it's not eaten within 5 minutes of being made.

Not "authentic" but better than most. It fits perfectly right into the Marina District's vibe. It's definitely on my radar and my next stop if I'm craving tacos around the Marina.
author: Joshua F.

description: Excellent fish tacos, fresh and grilled to perfection.  Quick and simple dinner out on a Saturday just what we wanted before heading home to the burbs.  Limited sit down dining in tiny space but eating early at 5:30p it wasn't a problem.  Nothing fancy but satisfying.
author: Gordon H.

description: TOMA! What an amazing array of items and each one better than the next. The burritos are reminiscent of authentic Mexico while at the same time giving you a modern fusion twist.  The ambiance is fun too! Although small in square footage the line can snake around the corner during one of their famous taco Tuesday's. Make sure to come by and have some amazing food with the best Mexican cuisine in the city.
author: Trip S.

description: This place has the best burritos in the marina! I love the breakfast burritos and usually add avocado- they put a generous amount in the burrito and always use the freshest ingredients. Their salsas are soooo delicious and they have several options. It's a tiny order at the counter place but the food is excellent.
author: Lady N.

description:
Easily the best burrito north of Noe Valley. Toma's menu has plenty of options. Took off one star because the chips are really lacking (see Tacko or Tacolicious). 

I will continue to order from Toma.
author: Mike P.

description:
I'm amazed at how extremly tasty the food was at toma.

We were craving mexican so we trekked over to toma from fisherman's warf. It was SO worth it. 

The food came out hot and fresh really fast. I ordered the chicken quesadilla and my guy ordered a smothered chicken burrito. 

The chicken and cheese was phenomenal.  The tortillas were tasty and flaky. I loved having choices of salsas and the green was my favorite. 

I highly recommend coming to toma for a bite to eat. Grab a sit outside and watch everyone on the street too.
author: Kaley K.

description:
I'm a little surprised by how well rated this place is. Firstly, Toma is such a tiny store. There is honestly only enough room inside for 6 - 8 people to stand/sit around. They do have a couple small spots outside to sit at. 

Our food came out pretty slowly and not in any type of order. People who ordered before me got their food way after I did. They also don't fill the cups all the way in their drinks which is kinda disappointing considering that it's not cheap.

I got the carne asada bowl, which while good was kind of small if you don't pay to get extra toppings. My friends enjoyed their tortas, quesadillas, and nachos, but it wasn't mind blowing and this is somewhere we wouldn't go out of our way to get or eat at if we were in the area.

Pro-tip: Check into Yelp for a free bag of chips!
author: Carol L.

description: Dry burrito. No salsa, guacamole or sour cream. I ordered take out and this might have caused it. Order in person to make sure this doesn't happen to you.
author: Moore H.

description: Had tried this place a couple of years ago and thought it was average and after going back today that was confirmed: it's average...very average. There's a real lack of deliciousness that you normally find in burritos, maybe because it's filled primarily with very rice and beans (where's the meat in this thing?)and the meat hasn't seen the love that most Mexican restaurants prioritize in giving? Even if you pay for extras that should probably come standard (cream, guac), I'd set the bar pretty low for you walking out of there satisfied with your $13 burrito; it's just not working, IMO. I can't tell if they're trying too hard or not enough with the ingredients. Like, you know when you go to a restaurant that touts high quality ingredients but then the food comes out and it's just not that good? It's kind of like that but in burrito form which I have to imagine is just not that common. Needless to say I'm surprised at the averageness of the burrito. And don't get me wrong, the people working in there are friendly it's just the burritos: they are very average. Consider walking up to Tacko or Burrito Express On Divisadero.
author: Jason P.

description: I was on chestnut street and I guess the premier Mexican food place is called "Tacolicious". The wait was an hour and a half and the food was over priced. Instead I found TOMA and lemme tell you...I'm glad I did . This place fills all the blanks  . They have big (Delicious af) burritos, great guac, beer and good music. This place is a hole in the wall but it's so simple , no BS, just simple good Mexican food . It's better than most sit down restaurants, definitely a great date spot . Even better for if you are Intoxicated or under the influence of the good stuff. Shout out to the girl at the counter
author: Dr T.

description:
Food is great here and reasonable price for being in the Marina. They fry their burritos and add sweet peppers and onions by default so you might wanna tell them before hand. Sour cream, gauc, cheese is all extra which I thought was crazy! But the servings are good and there's free salsa! 
PRO TIP: don't get any of the sides on "the side" they cost extra and if you check in at the place you get FREE CHIPS!
author: Miguel E.

description: It's an upscale hole in the wall taco joint . Service is slow because they make stuff fresh . Chips are not good. Limes are cut to small.
author: Kelly A.

description: Best Mexican food in the marina/cow hollow area. Everything is cooked fresh to order.
author: Dane M.

description: Wow, really great little taco stand.  Salsa is super fresh  and the tacos are awesome really flavorful.  If u like tacos and are in the area you should stop at Toma!
author: Rich A.

description:
I got takeout TOMA as a pick-me-up for a friend who was having a bad day. I wound up ordering a pork quesadilla and half-chicken, half-beef bowl, with free bag of chips and salsa for checking in on Yelp!

I love TOMA because 1) it's close to my home since I live in the Marina, and 2) it's really reasonably priced Mexican food that isn't Chipotle. Everything on the menu is less than $10 and is made to order, so it's super fresh and steaming hot when you get your food. 

The meat here is really delicious. I think that's why I enjoyed the food so much since the pork, beef, and chicken was so, so tasty. The protein MADE the dish. My quesadilla was super flavorful, though I did expect a larger portion size for the price that I paid. The bowls are a similar price and came with much more stuff.

Honestly, nothing really horrible to say about TOMA other than the fact that I didn't get the nicest vibe from the worker there. He was kind of blunt and slightly rude. It also kind of has a hole-in-the-wall feel to the place, which makes me automatically associate dirtiness with it, regardless of how clean the place actually is. Maybe they could amp up the decor a little bit more to make it seem more clean and welcoming. Also thought that there was a little too much grease in my food... to the point that my quesadilla got my hands dripping in oil after I finished it.

If your'e looking for an affordable meal with Mexican food, TOMA is your place! Highly recommend if you're looking to dine on a budget!
author: Sheila D.

description: Affordable Mexican joint that uses quality ingredients and takes their time to make sure the order is made without unnecessary haste. The service was great too, really friendly counter-person and the cooks in the back will sometimes deliver the food to you directly when you're just waiting for your order.
author: David Y.

description: The burritos here are great. As good or better than the Mission with better ingredients. Love the salsa bar too.
author: Ruth C.

description: Affordable taqueria in the middle on a busy high end street. Really good burritos and bowls. Do try out the fish tacos
author: Parthe P.

description:
My boyfriend and I found ourselves in Cow Hollow looking for casual food in a pretty fancy area. Toma was exactly the price point we were going for. 

I ordered a vegetable bowl with squash, tomatoes, and onions, and he got a chicken quesadilla. I thought the bowl was just average - I think my favorite part was the squash and tomatoes, and the salsa and chips. His quesadilla was much better. I would get that next time if I am in the area. 

We don't spend that much time here, but it would be a good place to come back to if looking for cheaper options. It's a pretty small place, so I guess more of a to-go place instead of sit down. Don't forget to check in on Yelp for a free bag of chips! It's a LOT of chips, and the salsa bar is awesome. I liked the mango salsa as well as the salsa verde.
author: Steph V.

description: Amazing food, very friendly workers!!! Perfect! I was in San Francisco for 10 days with my student group from Germany!! We were there a couple times. The Quesadillas are great...
author: Lorenzo M.

description: This was the first place I've ate here in San Francisco, I can definitely say it's really really good ! The sopes de adobado taste really awesome
author: Alondra R.

description: One of the most underrated burrito spots in town. Do yourself a favour and try the adobado (pork) burrito fajita style.
author: Ryan R.

description: Y'all this place is great. If you're in the marina and need want fresh mexican food with everything made in house, this is it. Tacos are amazing and it doesn't cost me half of my rent. They have a nice outdoor area to eat at but it's not a lot of seating so for sure take it to go. You can online order and pick it up super quickly. When you order guac it's a ton and its so fresh and tastes amazing! I will always keep going back to this place, you guys keep showing Tacko what's up with their weird ass not mexican themed mexican place. Love you Toma!
author: Shawna M.

description: Good food, think I just ordered the wrong thing. Fresh taqueria and super fast. Would return to try bowl. The bowl I got just had too much cheese in it
author: C M.

description: Used to hit this place up when in the area, but honestly it's just not good compared to food in the Mission. Meat's cooked to within an inch of its life and the veg isn't as fresh as those higher turnover spots you know. Then again, most people don't go to the Marina for ethic food.
author: Dennis W.

description: Amazing burritos! Favorite spot in the city and have recommended it to many others, their favorite too. The Thursday chile verde burrito is my favorite, but any other day I have the chicken burrito. Great for take out.
author: Rilee H.

description:
I like that you can pre-order for pickup, and they have it all ready for you. 
I had the veggie burrito, it was very good, veggies were nice texture, good bite size chunks. 
Salsa was not very spicy, but I like a big kick. 

Music they play was super cool, I love it ! Service was nice, I will be back here for sure!
author: Adrian M.

description:
I've been here several times during my lunch breaks. The cashiers are super friendly, and the food is made fairly quickly and is really delicious. I usually get the quesadillas de maiz and it's my go-to for lunch!

Recently discovered that they have online ordering, which is super convenient for those who have shorter lunch breaks!
author: Lexi T.

description: I have changed my opinion on this place.  its one of my favorite restaurants in the Marina.  Very authentic Mexican food and I eat here all the time.
author: Leslie M.

description:
I love the salsa bar.

The championes, or mushroom one is the best option. Their quesadillas are alright, but their burrritos are very good.

Make sure to check in everytime you go for free chips!
author: Neil P.

description:
I think I just about fell in love with their shrimp tacos and their carne asada rojas burrito...

Shrimp tacos were just about perrrfect.  Shrimp was super moist and cooked just right.  Everything about this taco was juicy AF.  Tortilla was freshly made!  It was thicker than what I'm usually used to, but still very good!

Carne asada roja burrito was mouth-watering.  So much juicy meat and the extra peppers were delicious.  Not spicy at all, but that can be fixed with some Tapatio or spicy salsa.

Only thing that I didn't like so much was the Pork Sopas.  Meat was a bit dry, and too much sopa.  Too much, too thick.  @_@ Two sopas in each order was already way too much for one sitting.  Also, too much beans which really overpowered the entire thing.  The beef sauce that came with this was delicious though!

Go for the shrimp tacos if anything!!! Burrito to follow.  Skip out on the sopas.  Check in for free chips! Go! *___*
author: Carena N.

description:
Disappointed with this place. Tried them a few times last year on Sundays because of their close proximity and they were open on the early side. Food was good enough for me to try them multiple times. 

More than once I would pick up burritos I ordered on the phone and when I got home it wasn't prepared as I had asked. Specifically: no pico de gallo. The last time I went, it happen twice! Once on the initial visit and then again when I returned to exchange for what were supposed tombs properly prepared burritos. 

I refuse to return.
author: Cecil C.

description: Coming from LA and NJ, the food selections seem standard but a bit pricey -- but the food is still of good quality. We tried the quesadilla de Maiz, which is excellent, and their Champinones (filled with sauteed mushroom) is blissful. The bowls are good but felt basic. Still a good spot to have a quick bite in a relatively less crowded area of San Francisco.
author: Alex H.

description:
My bf ordered the chicken mole burrito. I ordered a burrito bowl with shrimp as the main "meat."

The chicken mole burrito was SUPER good. I believe it is the Tuesday specialty. If you come here, get the burrito. Decent size and price. 

The bowl with shrimp was not only underwhelming, it also gave me a bloated stomach a few hours later, and then, the dreaded "runs"...... oh no. The shrimp tasted really salty and tasteless. Usually a sign of not fresh seafood. (Trust me on shrimp. I LOVE crustaceans, esp shrimp because they're the most accessible year-round critters)

Note on the restaurant: super small place in a very hip and busy section in Cow Hollow. 

I still would recommend this restaurant, but if you come, get the burrito. All of the "special of the day" meats looked like solid choices. I would discourage the bowl, as well as the shrimp selection.
author: Min Ju L.

description:
Has good Mexican food finally made its way to the marina?

Sadly, no.

It wasn't bad, but the carne asada nachos and the chicken burrito here were both not very impressive. The nachos were way too cheesy - and the lettuce and pico de gallo didn't really work well with the nachos - everything was soggy but not in a good way.

The salsa was fine but I am not sure why people are giving this place 4 stars. It must be that people have really low expectations for Mexican food in this area.

I hope to try their delivery service and update my review. It would be nice to not have to go across the city for decent Mexican food.
author: Jeff L.

description: We came here hoping for authentic mexican cuisine but what we got was rather tasteless. We've tried Carne Asada and Chicken special but it was bland, boring and barely enough for one person. There are so many other great options and Tacko is nearby so I'd definitely recommend going somewhere else.
author: Ali O.

description: Delicious burritos and salsa in this no frills take out eatery on Steiner St.  The burritos were perfect, they made no mistakes. We really enjoyed the flavor.
author: Tom T.

description: The lady at the front has an attitude problem. She kept rolling her eyes and then continued talking to the people in the kitchen. There's barely any meat in their burritos and everything is extra. It's no Mission style burrito either. So if you're looking for the authentic taste and value,go somewhere else.
author: Allison K.

description: Visited Toma tonight and enjoyed a burrito and my lady enjoyed their sopes. Everything was really tasty! We also had their guacamole, pico and chips. Flavor was on point, and the guy working the counter was really attentive and friendly. Definitely support these guys!
author: Kristopher S.

description: Really good food and it's cheap! Found parking right away at one of the meters. It's almost like a pop up shop place. Small seating area but I'm assuming everyone takes their food to go. Will be back!
author: Ashley N.

description: Good food, always super nice and friendly.  I usually go for the carne asada burrito or the breakfast burrito.  Neither ever disappoints.  Also pretty inexpensive for SF.
author: Brian K.

description: Delicious! Perfect fish tacos! Great location! A fun lunch place for sure! Loved it xo
author: Megan B.

description:
Toma is a tiny, tiny spot. Probably can't seat more than 15 people or so. Definitely a to-go kind of place. 

I ordered a steak bowl - the steak was pretty good. I wish the portion was bigger though (maybe because I was hungry). Other folks got quesadillas and I think it was alright for them, but probably have had better ones in the Mission or elsewhere. 

Overall, a solid place to go if you want a quick and cheap bite (well, relatively cheaper compared to the other food options in this neighborhood). 

(50/100)
author: Cassy H.

description: Pretty tasty little taco place, with delicious fish tacos. A little salty (but I love salt, so nbd for me), but the flavors were great. Also had the corn quesadillas with mushrooms, which were pretty tasty--the fish is definitely the star of the show. Great salsas and nice enough seating if it's not too busy. Would come back if I were in the area.
author: Amber H.

description: Born and raised in SF...by far the best tacos EVER! Homemade corn tortillas...makes you wanna slap the cook or cashier after the first bite!!!
author: Karen C.

description:
This is a decent spot if you're craving take out Mexican food in the Marina.  I had the carne asada burrito and was a little disappointed at the meat which was cut into very large pieces and was a bit chewy.  I did enjoy their salsa bar - there was one salsa in particular in the back right that was fresh and had a good kick to it.  And I would also recommend their agua fresca - on Sunday they had a honeydew one that was so good!
Also, it might be good to know that there's not much sitting space.  There are about 3 tables (2 outside and 1 inside) and a few stools along the wall.
author: Gloria N.

description: I don't eat burritos too often but I really like this place for those once a while cravings. They use quality meat and ingredients. Unlike most other tacquerias I've been to, the place doesn't smell like lard and neither does their food. Giving them 4 stars only because I think The salsa bar is lacking and can use a bit of improvement and rice was a bit on the crunchy side. Overall though, I love the place and will be back. The vegetarian burritos are super tasty. :)
author: Miss M.

description:
Avoid this spot. I've tried their dinner food and their breakfast food now. Their regular burritos and tacos are very average. Definitely a three star at best meal. 

My friend described this place as a safe place to eat because it doesn't make him sick and he lives next door to it but it's nothing to write home about. 

The reason they've earned one star from me is because I tried their breakfast burrito this morning. It was mostly undercooked potatoes with maybe a single egg inside. It was horrible. Upon telling the staff that I was expecting some meat and egg they stared at me, said sorry and shrugged their shoulders. 

Their are too many better places in the area than to eat bad food with worse service. Eat here at your own risk.
author: Nicholas H.

description:
It's always a pleasant surprise to walk into a small whole in the wall setup and get treated exceptionally well. Greeted with a smile and encouraged to try something new, my to-go order quickly changed to "for here". The chili verde  Pork was tasty. 
Hospitality..5 stars. And coming from the food industry myself, I know good service when I see it.
author: Brittany B.

description:
Waited 30 mins for a burrito. Guy was on his phone who took my order and didn't even look up. They prioritized online and call orders over walkin. Poor customer service experience.

Two stars because the food is good and there is potential to this place.
author: Frank E.

description: I had a vegetarian burrito.  Giving three stars because the ingredients where good HOWEVER it was very soup like and difficult to eat.  If I had ordered burrito soup in a bowl....that would be alright I suppose.  A bit pricey as well.  I may try it one more time.  I still wonder how they where able to get the burrito wrapped up and water tight LOL
author: John C.

description: Not as impressed with the food here as other reviewers are. Items I've tried, whether the sopas or some tacos, have come out dripping wet and drowning in sauce, and their taste just wasn't all that memorable. While I get that this might be a neighborhood favorite because it feels like a clean and "safe" space for gringos, there are so many more authentic and worthwhile experiences elsewhere in the city if you're craving some true Mexican food.
author: Vincent L.

description:
What a cool find. Cute and small, but the food is great and the service is stellar. I came in here on a Saturday morning and it was the perfect way to start the day. The service and the atmosphere just really made the place sing. Josh was the server and we immediately connected about shared interest in music; he was super friendly and really gave me a smile to start the day. The outdoor seating and weather was the perfect touch too.

But of course any restaurant must be judged by the quality of the food first and foremost! I had a wet chorizo and egg burrito and the free bag of chips (YAY!) from the Yelp thing. Both of these were made even better by the delicious amazing salsas...packed with flavor. 

This place definitely put a big smile on my face. Note that seating is kind of limited, but you can always take your delicious food to Fort Mason, it's only a couple blocks away.
author: Chris S.

description: Watermelon juice. Is on point with this place. I'd come here for just that alone. Now on to the juicy tasting parts. Food is tasty with a selection of spices and sauces to add in the bar nearby. I would always take this place to go as it is not the greatest to eat in. But then again, take the food to go and eat at the park a few blocks away. Problem solved for you whiners who complain about lack of butt space.
author: Dennis S.

description: Nice enough people. But soggy quesadilla. So wet, it melded with the wrapper. How can you get a quesadilla wrong?! ...and we were the only customers they were serving.
author: Savannah L.

description:
The staff was nice.
Meat was salty & had a few fat chunks. 
Wet burrito medium size
The "wet" red sauce too salty. Hot sauce & green sauce wasn't too great it was all over seasoned.
Probably should have gotten the tacos.
The chips were good.
I threw half the burrito away.
author: Matt M.

description: First off the music was blasting at 11 am. A place this small should not be playing music with trumpets so loud. You would think a soccer game was about to start. The place has no restroom and they told me to go use the restroom at another restaurant which I should have went to in the first place. I order nachos which turned out to be 13.99 and there wasn't even any guacamole in it.Way too much lettuce more than chips! For that price they added mushrooms which made my stomach bloated for 3 days. The nachos were just thrown in the microwave and the cheese was melted that way. Totally unprofessional. I will never go to this place again.
author: Joey G.

description:
The food at Toma is so fresh and flavorful - I didn't even miss having the cheese in my burrito bowl! 

I dropped in for lunch to-go today, and my inner monologue was having a real struggle between choosing a burrito, or the burrito bowl. Bad Day Liz was telling me hefty burrito, but Bridesmaid-Dress-in-Two-Weeks Liz said go for the burrito bowl. Dress Liz won out, and I was not disappointed in what I was given!

The pollo asado (chicken) burrito bowl was big in flavor and the size was perfectly portioned. Grilled chicken breast, romaine lettuce, about 1/2 cup each Mexican rice and black beans. No cheese included, but you can add it (or guacamole or sour cream) for a charge. It honestly didn't need more dressing up than two scoops of fresh salsa from their salsa bar! 

Everything was made to order, hot and fresh. The people working there were nice as well. Can't wait to make another lunch break stop sometime soon!
author: Liz G.

description:
Don't let the hole in the wall size of this spot turn you off.  Place an order and take it back home or to your car.  

I had the pork burrito with both veggie mixes.
My friend had the barbeqou tortas.

Both were perfect. 
Spot-on flavor.  Perfect dinner portions. Fresh. Vibrant. Salsa bar to complement. 

Eat here. Thank me later.
author: Angeles W.

description: Not good at all. The decried beans were dry, the chips were store bought, guacamole was literally just creamed avocado (since when can you call that guac?) the carne asada meat in my bowl was good but there was so little meat.
author: Angie B.

description: From the good reviews, I thought this place would be delicious. It's less than mediocre. I got the torta with champiñones (mushrooms) which was highly unimpressive. No flavor. There are way better taquerias in the Mission (and several other districts) but what else did I expect from the Marina?
author: Julia A.

description: I'll just get right into this. I seen $30 on nachos burrito and a drink. Wind blowing inside they have the door open and this huge window. And I ask if the window can be closed. She said yes. Then said no cause it's hot. Our napkins are blowing all around and I didn't want our food to get cold. They could've opened the window once we left. I won't be returning. This is my first time here.
author: Mariah J.

description: My friends and I ate here today for lunch and it was great! We all enjoyed our burritos and quesadillas - great flavor especially the carne asada. The orders came out timely and the modifications we made to them were perfect. We all felt great afterwards for having such big burritos! The owner was there today and he was super friendly and attentive, there's definitely a pride in ownership here and we will all be returning!!!
author: Jasmine C.

description: The owner is lovely and makes sure the food is fresh.  He is meticulous with the salsa's and the each food item.  I just had an amazingly, flavorful Rancho Rancheros Burrito.  I've been here many times and it is consistently excellent.
author: Krista L.

description:
Burritos. A staple particularly in This City of origin. San Francisco is considered the historic center of the economical and handy meal. How do fringe purveyors compete, with, with the legacy and with the outliers?

TOMA is a huge addition to the Chestnut Street - Union Street communities of those who consider themselves connoisseurs and success stories in our Contemporary Era. When it was covered that, another, local vendor of Latino foods, had been frequented by one of our chosen, illustrious hurlers for a World Champion team of 'ballers, all was the rage, both for that singled-out provider of Fish Taco, but the lane, and its tangents, all providers of nutrition and flavor and texture, seemed to benefit: it is a challenge to arrive on time to one's Apple Store Genius Bar or Online Pickup appointment without having to step off of the curb and ride the bus stop to circumvent the words are wealthy eaters and shoppers at The Gap...

TOMA took over a small insert from a former 'dog vender, which, I could never understand, how they could have possibly made a dent in the food consciousness of those just down the street serving one of the best 'burger meals in town, at Barney's, or, the greenaholics' Vegan food and juicer, The Planet Cafe (don't get me started about the 10 other eateries across a spectrum one also has to consider as you approach this hole in the wall.)

The uniqueness of TOMA is in its entire presentation of an eatery. Yes, one can gather a traditional fare down and around the corner at Los Hermanos, But, there seems to be a Fish Taco price war heating up between LH and Tacolicious: on the way up, not down, a disservice to the consumer, despite many who have deep pockets.

What should one expect to pay for a burrito in San Francisco: any district to any degree of authenticity, substance, healthiness, cleanliness?

About $9.

Add shrimp? Another $2.

My only complaint with TOMA: the board featuring its daily special meat option is nowhere near the main menu above the register; I had no idea I had an option other than standard fare or their signature, pre-defined burrito.

Yet, the staff were kind enough to provide me with a taste sample of the daily special, which was absolutely amazing.

I had already committed to a pork protein which, grilled to order from a container where it had been marinating, was simply divine inside my burrito.

The size was not ginormous but it was substantial.

The beans were perfect: firm but giving to the teeth; fresh and flavorful; no extra liquid including the starchy substance one can encounter infusing a burrito.

The balance in texture, flavor, color, each ingredient layered, fresh: perfect.

I am not a huge fan of any other burrito in San Francisco: consider a venn diagram to consider all burritos in San Francisco - those you may walk or drive to in your local community.

That is one interesting fact about the distribution of burritos in the San Francisco: somehow, the Illuminati of Ethnic Foods make it impossible to have real choice. Consider La Canasta, on Buchanan. They have an attitude of convenience, a constant pulse of families, au pairs, nannies, 'sitters, double parked to pickup phone orders.

Burritos and pizza are in a neck and neck competition for the Lacrosse Moms and Dads as post- practice nutrition, reward and celebration substance.

TOMA is hungry for success. If you look at reviews on Yelp* over the past 7 months, notice how the criticism, possibly sound, has been matched by the staff in the food in front of you: it is improved at each step and turn.

Someone is reading these reviews and improving on a dime.
author: Jim N.

description:
This is a great quick taco / burrito joint with fresh ingredients, decent prices (for sf) and good hours compared to a lot of surrounding restaurants. 

As far as the food goes, the thing Toma has down that a lot of similar places mess up is the meat--everything is cooked only once you order it, and looks high quality when they pull it out and throw it on the grill. The staff is always friendly, though it can be a bit of a wait if you hit it when a bunch of people come in. 

Overall a great tasting, quick Mexican place with lots of tasty options
author: Zack H.

description: I happened upon this place while strolling the Marina. I had some amazing shrimp tacos made with home made tortillas and fresh pico. It's a charmingly small place with cozy seating. The music gives it an authentic feel. The salsa bar is excellent. I'd like to say I've tried more of the menu but every time I eat here I just got straight for the shrimp tacos.
author: Justin G.

description:
TOMA is a little stop-in shop mostly to grab takeout or a quick bite, but it looks really clean and has a nice, simple menu.

My friend and I got tacos, I got camarones (shrimp) and the tortilla was fresh + delicious! The quality was also really good. I'd come back next time to try their sopes.

Also, I got the watermelon agua fresca, which was perfect - not too sweet and hit the spot.
author: Denise R.

description: Good food for a good price. And a nice beer makes it, yum. I had the beef and chicken Taco's and they were both excellent with the salsa bar.
author: Jason H.

description:
This is an amazing hole in the wall place. 

It's a great burrito places in the marina area.  The chicken burrito is wonderful.  Try the sauces too.  

Location, sitting outside, food all are wonderful.

However after trying it many times, the quality of the food is highly variable and it can be very bland and tasteless.
author: Ahmad A.

description: Food is pretty good - especially nachos, and prices more fair than other Mexican in area. However, no bathrooms for customers as they enjoy their lunch or dinner. That's not right.
author: Claire V.

description: Great little place next to our hotel. Food was very good, but, not much help on menu items and sauces, very much a local thing as judged by the amount of take outs being picked up. Thanks to a local picking up educated my on the sauces.
author: Brian T.

description: My FAVE burrito place in the Marina.  Order it on app, pick up in 20 or less. SOOO delicious and their fire salsa is super spicy (which I loooooove).  They're all super nice and allow for all the customization you'd want.  Don't forget the fresh salsa on the way out. YUMMMM!
author: Andy S.

description: Walked past this place and decided to give it a try because I was STARVING. Luckily, it wasn't a bad settle because the burrito really had good flavor. I'm usually very skeptical about what is considered a "good burrito" (especially in the Marina) but was so surprised by the authenticity it had! I just ordered an alpastor burrito with chips-- finished the entire thing. I noticed they serve mole also, I will definitely be back to give the mole a try! It's a childhood favorite of mine so I hope it doesn't disappoint!
author: Reina C.

description:
I ate at here on Friday night and I didn't think it was going to be this delicious! I had a steak taco and a Adobado. The Adobado was super good! My favorite for sure! Hand made tortillas made it even better. What topped it off was the Horchata! Horchata was on point! My gf is from Mexico and she definitely approves! This place is perfect for a lunch dinner or a late snack. I can't speak for their other food. But in sure it's as good as their tacos. Coming back soon! 
Nice job TOMA.
author: Luis G.

description:
WOW! Where has this place been.

You know what I love about small no frills joints, they usually get pt all their effort into their food flavors, and with Toma, it absolutely fits this quality.

My friend and I went here last Friday and ordered two vegetarian fajitas (one with zucchini and squash and the other with mushrooms) - both came wiht onions and green peppers. The flavors were delicious!  We also checked  in via Yelp and got free chips. I usually don't like chips at Mexican restaurants but these chips were hearty and flavorful.  They also have a sauce bar with 3 different sauces and pickled onions, in addition to bottled red and green salsas.  While we were there for 45 minutes, we saw at least ten people either dine in or carry out. Definitely seems like a winning spot.  

Highly recommend;  I know I'll be back ;)
author: Monica J.

description: Great burritos, good price! About $8-$10 depending on extras, very filling and would come again.
author: Abigail H.

description:
Got their chicken burrito with guacamole(which cost an extra $1 points f you want to add the guacamole) to go. Wasnt too busy so was able to get my food within 10 minutes or less. The taste of burrito was average. Decent size. It could get you full if you eat the whole thing.
 
Small place. But they do have sitting area if you want to dine in.

It kinda pricy if you want to add guacamole and/or sour cream for the burrito since it doesnt come with it. I guess its an okay price for the marina district. But of course you can get their free sauce from their sauce booth area.
author: Julie N.

description:
My husband and I were staying at a nearby hotel and found this place. Great food and wonderful service at a fair price! We would definitely come back again when in the city!  

If you are looking for great food check this place out!
author: Haley W.

description:
The chorizo breakfast burrito was spot on.  Great little find while staying in the marina. 

After a big night, there's no better way to start your day.
author: Andrew L.

description:
Can't go wrong with the tacos especially on Barbacoa Fridays! There aren't to many places that make their corn tortillas in house plus all the ingredients are fresh with the meat made to order not sitting in a bin all day long. 

PS They started serving tamales on the weekend. Picked up a dozen last weekend.. Grub!
author: Richard R.

description:
This puny restaurant has quite a lot to offer than I expected. My girlfriend and I wanted something really simple so we could take it to Marina Green and eat while enjoying the Golden Gate view. We ordered the chicken burrito and some chips (they were free after I checked-in via Yelp). The portion was quite nice, the meat was well-seasoned, and the salsa we used for our chips was fresh! We had a really good meal, and kind of regretted not ordering more!

The only drawback is that the restaurant was very cramped, and it seemed like they didn't wipe the tables as often. I could find stains on their tables, and I was a bit bothered while waiting for our food. But if you want a quick Mexican take-out, then this is a place to go! Also, a big shoutout to one of the guys who tried to impress me with his minimal Korean skills! (I'm Korean, and I speak fluent Korean).
author: Paul C.

description:
My hubby and I had burritos, his with chicken, mine with steak. Both of us were commenting in how well seasoned the meat was to each other. We both enjoyed them immensely!

Note: The place is tiny. There are about 6 or 7 chairs to sit on at a bar style table, and 2 tables outside. Delicious food, though! Definitely recommend!
author: Britt P.

description:
Holy Hair Nets! - OR LACK THERE OF!!!

I have been a regular visitor to Toma and think the food is pretty darn good.  We had an experience the other day that will keep us from going back, probably forever.   Check out the picture I uploaded of my wife's quesadilla.  Not one, not two, but a clogged drains worth of hair baked in with the cheese.  She tried to skip this part and move on to another slice - same thing - more hair.  

I am sorry Toma, but we'll never look at you the same again.  It's not you, it's us.  No wait, it is you.
author: Mr. Papshmir ..

description: Great Salsa and Guac. Burrito filled me up real quick! Going again next time with the family.
author: Robert V.

description: The food was great and the service was awesome!! Right next to the hotel im staying at. I highly recommend this spot!
author: Anthony V.

description: I don't know why this place has 4 stars and so many good reviews. It's over priced Mexican food and not good at all. I got a chicken burrito which was mostly beans. The service was also bad. Went here on a Sunday night and the lady taking our order was very rude. I would not recommend going to Toma for authentic Mexican food.
author: Sep R.

description: Excellent and friendly service! The food was absolutely delicious!! Will definitely be back to visit Toma!
author: Angelica B.

description: Burrito was excellent, loved the steak and fajitas, only reason it didn't get 5 stars was it was smaller than most burritos I get from taquerias
author: Matt W.

description: I was pleasantly surprised by Toma. Got their regular burrito with carne asada. It was very flavorful and the ingredients tasted fresh. I've been pretty underwhelmed with the "top burritos" in San Francisco, finding them to be unbearably bland, or made with poor quality ingredients, so I was pleasantly surprised to find something tasty in my neighborhood.  I'll definitely be back to try the nachos, and get more burritos!
author: Gieselle A.

description:
If you want a damn good breakfast burrito, you will find it at this place. 

Huge breakfast burritos that will leave you full until dinner time. You can substitute potatoes for rice in the breakfast burrito. I had the vegetarian burrito but the veggies were well-seasoned and was no where near bland, which can sometimes be the case with vegetarian dishes. Make sure to grab the sauces to layer on with each bite, they add a nice flavor kick to each bite. The guacamole is absolutely delicious here. There isn't much seating so it's best to order takeout and take your meal to the Marina Green or back home. 

Also, ToMa is an inexpensive breakfast option for the city!
author: Michelle W.

description: Was very disappointed because the tacos were too thick and very soggy. I got the vegetable and chicken tacos. The fillings were very tasty but the thick and mushy corn tortilla was not pleasant to eat. The chips were also not very good because it's those type of chips you get at movie theaters for nachos. blegh. Service was friendly and outdoor seating was nice. Not coming back here again though.
author: Jacqui C.

description:
Posting the correct price would be helpful. Service with a smile would be even better.  Cleanliness and kindness would help even more.  Serving what I ordered would be even more helpful.  

My favorite thing is the lack of effort to make things right. 


I think I actually have to say it out loud: you ripped me off.

To top it all off, the tasteless, over salted food was so unappetizing I could hardly stomach it.

(Oh, and, you never brought me that ice water I asked for)
author: Anthony H.

description: Delicious food, amazing homemade tacos and kind staff. Stumbled upon this place on a Saturday night-- great service, made to order, but came out super fast! Highly recommend and would be delighted to return.
author: Suzy L.

description:
Leave America for a bit and enjoy a meal at Toma! 
It is a very nice little restaurant. The staff is really friendly. I had a carne asada taco and carne asada quesadilla. Both were fantastic!! This is a great spot, definitely a place I will go to more often from now on!
author: Romain D.

description:
Shout out to TOMA for making me feel like a star at lunch today. 

Every Wednesday is catering day for the start-up I work at in SOMA. This week we went with TOMA (TOMA in SOMA? Nice) and I'm glad we did. This was by far the best catering lunch we've had. 

The food arrived on the dot and my coworkers and I waited a torturous 15 minutes before we decided to dig in early. The set up looks professional and there was a TON of food for the price that we paid. Some favorites were the gluten free handmade tortillas that were part of our taco bar, the chicken mole, the 5 choice salsa spread, and the carne asada. 

Everything was flavorful, fresh, and rich. Usually we switch off to different restaurants every week, but I think we'll just be sticking with TOMA from now on.
author: Katie N.

description: Excellent grilled chicken burrito. The chicken was seasoned perfectly, and the guacamole extremely tasty. Will be back.
author: Kip C.

description: If you are in the neighborhood on a Monday you definitely should try their chile colorado special in a bowl, very tasty! Their tortas are good and burritos are decent. Their salsa bar is a fun perk as I love to drench my food in salsas caseras. The service is always great with their friendly cashiers. My husband likes their beer options and enjoys the small corner taqueria style of the restaurant.
author: Cindy G.

description: Toma is awesome -- fresh, flavorful food, great salsa bar, and friendly service. I've been here several times and am never disappointed. Favorite spot in the neighborhood for a burrito!
author: Brianna A.

description: Great spot.  Tiny hole in the wall, but great to pop in for a cold beer and fresh tacos on a hot day.  Soft taco shells are made in house and are thick and delicious.
author: Matt M.

description: I probably get a burrito from Toma 4x a month............................SO GOOD.
author: Elizabeth K. A.

description:
I confess to my biases.  My first burrito memories are from an LA food truck in the late seventies, where you could get a gut bomb burrito only slightly smaller than a jr. high football for $1.25.

Toma is quite good but the portions are smallish and the price is pricey.  At Los Hermanos which is cheaper, I usually had a decent size portion remaining for a snack.  At Toma, I usually ate the whole thing and was still a bit hungry.

The guys who own/run the place are awesome, and I wish I could justify a higher rating.  If you are rich and want a tasty, expensive snack, this is the place for you.
author: Steve S.

description:
Good price under 3 bucks for a chicken taco.  The taco though was tiny and I found the chicken to be too dry.  Did like their small salsa toppings bar and the corn taco itself had some good flavor.  Overall found it to be a too tiny portion with too little chicken and flavor underwhelming. 
So take my review for what it is worth- I didn't splurge for the burrito, as everyone else was ordering, but this tiny taco wasn't worth the price or the annoying 25 minute take-out wait for 1 taco.  Pathetically I later found myself across the way filling up with more flavorful tacos at Taco Bell with a 2 minute wait and half the price.
author: Alexandra C.

description: Today was TOMA day! I look forward to it every time. The food is always fresh, flavorful and nicely portioned. Its also a nice spot to stop in for quick and authentic Mexican food. The staff is always friendly and helpful with suggestions. I am often helped by Lizeth who makes great suggestions every time I'm in the mood for something different. She never has steered me wrong! And I have made a point to look for her every timeI visit the restaurant!!
author: Kristina M.

description: Ordered a chicken burrito and chips with guac for delivery today. The burrito came with refried beans, rice, sour cream, guac and chicken. The ingredients were really fresh and tasted similar to a mission-style burrito. The chips and guac are also a really good deal! Chips are a little salty but they gave you a huge thing of fresh guac for only $4. Also points for a delivery around 45 minutes, which is hard to come by in the city. Breakfast burrito will be my next try here!
author: Allison D.

description:
A great new biz around the corner from the San Fran hotel we were staying at. Fast, friendly service and the burritos were inexpensive and very filling.

There are literally a handful of chairs inside  and couple of tables outside so it sure is 'fast food' where they are expecting much more of the take-out crowd rather than sit in but it seems to be working so far.
author: Rickie J.

description:
05.12.14 etc. | bookmarked 01.15.13

Toma has quickly become our neighborhood quick burrito fix. Big servings, friendly service, and amazing salsa.

Like!
author: Jenny L.

description: Wasn't a fan - at all. For some reason it came up on my "gluten free" search but the girl at counter had no idea what I meant even though she assured me it was gluten free. The guy making the tacos literally put my husband's flour tortilla on my corn tortillas and obviously I got sick. Other than that it tasted super bland- I wasn't a fan of the shrimp tacos or chicken and my husband thought his beef burrito wasn't good either (he said the beef was way too chewy). So many great taco places in Cali- you can skip this one
author: Jessica F.

description:
Love this place!  Food is fantastic (and authentic).  Prices are very reasonable.  I always add a few dollars to my bill with a Horchada, but it is always worth it.  Best Horchadas ever!!!

Usually, I just stop in for lunch or grab dinner to go.  I have also used their catering.  I needed a bunch of breakfast burritos for a kids birthday party.  Ysidro, the owner, was great to work with. The modified the ingredients a little so that they were just perfect for kids.  He also met me at the store several hours before they opened so that I could get the burritos in time.  It worked out great.  I was initially going to order from a breakfast spot in the 'hood, but they wouldn't accommodate any of my requests and were going to charge me twice as much,

I always feel good about buying from TOMA.  The entire staff is great and the food is always good.
author: Michelle D.

description: Average food and poor service.   Been there five times and the cash register person is always just awful.  Expensive and just no commitment to the food they are making.  There are better places in the Marina for sure.
author: Bill S.

description: We came here right before we left for the airport. I had the chicken tacos and they were delicious.  The tortilla is a little different than "normal" tortillas, but it was great!
author: Hazel M.

description: All I have to say is wow. This place exceeded my expectations. There are many Mexican places that taste pretty generic. But this one has so much flavor and taste authentic. The pricing isn't bad and the service is great. Definitely coming be here again. Ordered a carne asada super burrito it was delicious had to take some tacos to go since it was so good. I recommend going here.
author: Bryan P.

description: Delicious tacos! The tacos are on fresh corn tortillas and topped with flavorful chicken. Love this place.
author: Sophie M.

description: Stopped for a late lunch, really good food and great music too! Loved the veggie burrito and tacos that we had. The staff is so friendly and polite, fresh food and nice people - perfect.
author: Shamsher S.

description: My coworker shared some amazing pork nachos and the horchata is too good to share! Can't wait to try more!
author: Marcella Y.

description: Ordered delivery. SO GOOD! Had the rajas burrito (carne asada) and rajas bowl (chicken), and both were bursting with flavor. This is gonna be my new go-to mexican delivery place. They're quick too!
author: Melissa G.

description: BEST PINEAPPLE JUICE !! The food is amazing and is authentic Mexican food not like Taco Bell
author: Jacqueline P.

description: This spot has some really delicious salsas. It's probably my favorite thing about Toma. Their tacos are a nice size as well. The only bad part about this place is their carne asada is just super chewy. Don't order the carne asada, get the Wednesday special -Carnitas! Bomb!
author: Brooke F.

description: Pretty tasty! Just check your food before you leave. They forgot the guacamole in my burrito. It was an amazing burrito, but it could've been a bomb ass burrito!
author: Fredo L.

description:
Solid spot. The grilled pork and grilled chicken are great.

Tip: if you get a "bowl" sometimes they will fill up the entire tray and you might get more quantity than if you had ordered the burrito.
author: max m.

description: Amazing service with the sweetest girl taking our order! Recommended the barabquavo sort of a pulled pork bowl, looks amazing! Tastes better! And then the tacos! Got chips and guacamole and the salsa! Great food and a lovely time!
author: Marie-Louise O.

description: Awesome burritos. Their specials are amazing, especially the barbacoa and carnitas. Breakfast burritos are good as well. I wish their guacamole was a bit creamier/thicker, but it's still good. The staff is also very friendly.
author: Maxwell B.

description:
The food was very good.    The execution was sorely lacking. 
Their GrubHub options leave it so that on any dish ordered you may only pick one thing to add to it. So if you wanted to add guacamole and/or sour cream to your burrito or taco you would only be able to add one and would not be able to add something like chips. 
In addition, they need to read the tickets on GrubHub orders because half of our order was incorrect. 
Would have been four stars if they had not blown the order so badly.
author: Alex A.

description: Casey is the best cashier and they cooks are very nice and super talented
author: Ariana F.

description: I've been to this place twice. The first time I came, I had a good experience, but was a less than average time.  The chips for my nachos tasted like they were a week old!! The nachos were completely stale! I also had a burrito which was fine, nothing to get excited about. I came back to this place because the first time I thought  everything was good, the service was great- the guy even gave my girlfriend and I free tacos and drinks! Today was a totally different story- probably won't return in the future.
author: J C.

description: Torn between 3 and 4 stars.  I quite like the food - solid four stars for a takeaway.  Nothing special but perfectly good.  I don't like that things such as sour cream and guacamole are extra - the bit on the overhead menu which says this is obscured from easy view, and you are offered them as if they were included.  That's half a star removed.  I particularly don't like that they expect minimum tips of 15% for service when there is no service.  That's another half star removed, making three in total.
author: Norman B.

description: Best Mexican food hands down!!! This will be a spot I will go to every time I come to San Francisco and I will be telling all my friends to go. I thought tortas were gross, until I tried theirs. And the tacos!!! My mouth is watering thinking about them
author: Erika H.

description: I had a chicken burrito and a steak torta. Both were very good. Burrito was big and I liked how it wasn't messy. Torta was very impressive. I got it to go and when I got home I was surprised it wasn't soggy. The carne asada was cooked perfect and the guac and tomato complimented it very well.
author: Teddy K.

description: Surprised to find a good burrito spot in the Marina.. I've only tried the chicken so far.
author: DJ Madison H.

description:
Popped in for a quick meal. Got the chicken burrito and horchata. Both were really good. The burrito was bigger than I could handle so I got two meals out of it. 

There's a counter and a few tables outside. It's more of a takeaway place but it's cute if you can find a seat.
author: Jeanette C.

description:
I've been going here several times a week for months. Great burrito bowls. 

I would not recommend the salsa they leave out - it must not be fresh, because I got food poisoning after I ate there last night and it's the first time I've used it (never had a problem before). Not a fun 24 hours, but otherwise great food.
author: Jonathan K.

description: Authentic!!! Best taco in SF. Been eating around checking out different places. Can't go wrong with a homemade tortilla and good seasoned meats!! Breakfast nachos are very good too.
author: Gilbert R.

description:
5 Stars for TOMA!  We have done several catered Taco Bar orders with Isidro and our clients are absolutely loving the food!  Everyone is raving about the flavor and others are joining in on our meetings that never cared to-thanks to TOMA!
Simple to order, and always on time, we are thankful to have such a great restaurant to work with for our Architect Luncheons!

-Krystal Bourne
NSP3
North State Playgrounds
author: Krystal B.

description:
This place is great. We order from here about once a month for delivery. We have tried all the Mexican places in the area and TOMA serves the best meat. Their chicken and steak are what should get this place 5 stars...but... 

Where they can pick it up a bit is on their delivery. Every time, at least one item is always missing. Whether it is guac and sour cream in our burrito bowls or forgetting to add salsa with the chips ( and really salsa in general. When you order mexican you expect salsa. Should be a given.) I also don't get how they make their own tortillas but have store bought chips? I keep going back because the meat and homemade tortillas. And would love to give this place 5 stars if they picked their delivery game up.
author: Mark M.

description: I had a bowl with fajitas and chicken and guacamole and every single thing tasted fresh. I ate the entire thing and I honestly don't think it's meant to be for just one person. It was really really good.
author: Anika K.

description:
All natural ingredients; made to order.  Be sure you order it how you like it: there are lots of hidden menu options: best burritos & Mexican food in Marina/Cow Hollow!!

My favorite is the Chili Verde on Thursdays or the Chicken Burrito: 1/2 the beans/rice + the spicy pico salsa + the salsa verde + onions/cilantro + Avocado (instead of Guac) and no cheese.

And the breakfast burrito always hits the spot when I get there earlier in the day.

The on-line ordering is an easy way to get my custom order just right!

And the tamales on the weekend taste just like the home made ones my family makes!

Once you figure out your favorite salsa and spiciness you'll be coming back all the time!
author: Jason E.

description: It's good to see small mom and pop places do well. I had bought food for a whole slew of people doing work for a tv shoot. Their prep had started the night before and normally they'd have cooked their own family meal. So I decided to buy for them and take part myself. Good solid tacos. chicken mole (special), chicken and beef. Pretty tasty stuff. I can also attest for a group of 22 others. Folks are really friendly and they knocked the order out pretty quickly. Think of this as something between a taqueria and maybe something more upscale like Tacolicious nearby. Fresh clean fare with friendly service? Absolutely
author: Kim N.

description:
TOMA is my favorite place to get my Mexican food fix.  I usually go at least once a week if not twice.  Their food is very fresh and clean which I like in Mexican food.  I'm not a fan of super greasy Mexican food that's dripping with oil.  The customer service is excellent too.  Everyone is extremely friendly and attentive.  

For the food, I would recommend the chicken burritos or tacos.  Those are my constant go-tos.  Squeeze some lime and put the mild red sauce on it and it just tastes delicious.  Also, if you like mushrooms or squash, both choices are excellent and very flavorful. I love mushrooms so sometimes I just get a mushroom burrito and some cantaloupe agua fresca and call it a day.  Speaking of their agua frescas, all the flavors I've ever tried are so so soo good.  Cantaloupe, watermelon, pineapple and the horchata are all amazing and pair perfectly with the food.  I definitely find myself craving the juices on those rare warm days in SF.

The other day I decided to try a chicken quesadilla with guacamole and sour cream and it was the best decision I made that week!  I love quesadillas with just cheese and chicken, but with the extras it was just unbelievably yummy.  Their quesadillas are huge too and I ate the whole thing in one sitting because it was that good.  I was very proud of myself that day.  

If you're ever in the Marina and craving Mexican food, definitely give this spot a try.  You won't be disappointed and I think you'll even walk away impressed by everything TOMA has to offer.  I know I am!
author: Jessica L.

description: The shell of the taco wasn't great, they put tomato instead of cilantro and onion, and they didn't have carnitas when I went. They do give a large side of guac so that's in their favor. The adobado was chewy and not too memorable. Meh.
author: Shaymaa M.

description:
I've been going to TOMA since they first opened and they never let me down. This is easily the best burrito in the city!!! 

They do daily specials including chicken pozole, garlic shrimp, chile verde, barbacoa all of which are simply amazing! Their chorrizo and egg breakfast burrito is one of my favorites.

They make their corn tortillas in house, right in front of you!! You can taste the freshness and high quality in every bite!
TOMA is very transparent in showcasing where they source their ingredients, all of which are local.

I would highly encourage you to take your friends to TOMA, and enjoy authentic quality Mexican recipes!!
author: Robert L.

description: More of a lunch spot, but came here to grab a quick dinner before an event nearby. I had the pork & carne asada tacos, which were so, so good. Hub had the carne asada burrito. The staff was super friendly and gave us a few suggestions when we asked. I'd definitely come back here.
author: Megan B.

description:
Okay so this place is hit or miss. I work nearby so I had the chance to come here 3 days in a row basically (because of a paypal coupon).
When people think Mexican food, I feel the first thing they think of is burritos. Word of advice: DON'T GET THE BURRITOS. They will NOT satisfy you. However, DO GET THE TORTAS. 
My fav is the chicken torta. It is amazing and warm and toasty and savory and sure to make you happy.
The burritos are dry and if you get carne asada it will be dry and tough and cut far too big. The chicken burritos weren't any better. Chicken was good but the rest was dry. 
In conclusion, get the chicken torta. You will not regret it. 


UPDATE: MY TORTA BREAD WAS MOLDY. SO DISAPPOINTED
author: Tania C.

description:
A great little spot in the Marina. Friendly staff, no frills Mexican food and lively music to pass the time while dining in.  My favorite is the burrito bowl.  It's the perfect size and quite tasty when accompanied by their variety of serve yourself salsas.

It's nice to see a small business doing well in the competitive restaurant environment in the Marina.  I think the key is offer tasty food, hire a friendly face to take customer orders and keep it simple!
author: Rob L.

description: Although this tiny gem is a little hard to find! It is by far some of the freshest and tastiest Mexican Restaurants here in SF and that's coming from a SF native! When entering said establishment, the staff greats each guest with a friendly smile. The menu is traditional, yet imaginative.  I love the unique blend of grilled meats and poblano chiles in their Raja burrito. The side salsa choices are fresh and delicious, yet a little hard to reach.  The music is definitely a toe tapper and familiar to my husband's native Cuban background. I enough making this my new lunchtime special and look forward to trying the entire menu!
author: Camie L.

description:
I'm shocked by the 4 1/2 star review of this place, given my experience.  I was hoping this would finally be the legit, go-to Mexican spot near Chestnut, but nope, it isn't.  I'm just glad I didn't get sick based on what I saw inside this place!

I ordered a carne asada burrito to go. After ordering, I sat and watched the cooks in the back.  The guy manning the grill proceeded to pull raw chicken out of the marinade bucket and put it on the grill, then use the same tongs to flip and remove the carne asada that was on the other side of the grill. He did this numerous times, potentially cross contaminating the meat that was being pulled off the grill. Dude, that's like cooking 101.  

After witnessing this I went to the register to change my order to a quesadilla and side of chips and salsa. You can tell a lot about a Mexican place by their salsa bar.  TOMA's salsas were literally the most watered down and flavorless I've had in my life. Whether they're watered down to save money or because the cooks don't know what they're doing, it doesn't really matter, either way this is a sure sign of a subpar Mexican joint.  

The quesadilla was nothing to write home about. 

I also asked for a side of enchilada sauce which they forgot to put in the bag. 

I can't think of a single reason to return to this place.
author: Dan G.

description: Best Mexican food in San Francisco. Best salsa, burrito, and I'm picky! Mission places have nothing on Toma!
author: Talia R.

description: May have been the best quesadilla with calabacitas I have had. Perfect meal after a long walk along the water. If/when I am back in San Francisco, I will be back!
author: Alex E.

description:
TOMA is really just a taco/burrito takeout joint, but boy what a joint it is. Simply amazing burritos made however you like. Fajita style, chile verde, you name it. I had the pork chile verde with fajita veggies. The nice gentleman behind the counter gave me a sample and I was hooked. Said it was slow cooked for many hours. 

Indeed, it was mouth watering. We then chatted for a while. I asked him about the salsas. He pointed to one in the back and said it was his favorite because it was his grandmother's recipe and he grew up with it. Gotta appreciate that. Be warned, the burrito will cost you $10. But it will fill you for the entire day, and will be one of the best burritos you've ever had in your life.
author: Brian C.

description:
Solid and dependable option in the Marina. Not a huge menu, but after tacos, burritos, and tortas I'm not sure what else you need. I wish they opened earlier for breakfast burritos on the weekend.

Great salsa. Go for habanero. Just the right amount of kick. Glad they opened up.
author: Nathan W.

description: This place is legit!!! Love the Rajas burrito. Limited seating so better for carry out, but my boyfriend and I have sat outside here a few times and it's fun and casual.
author: Erin D.

description:
Very good a recommended stop! 
Had the marinated pork Soupas at the recommendation of Izzy and they were excellent. Freshly cooked and very nice staff ! 
We will stop again!
author: Dwayne L.

description: Definitely one of the best burritos I've had in the Marina area. I ordered a chicken burrito and chips and guacamole for delivery. The burrito's here are standard. It includes a flour tortilla, your choice of meat/vegetables, your choice of refried or black beans, cheese, and pico de gallo. I added guacamole to my chicken burrito for a $1 so it ended up being $8.25. The burrito was delicious and it was decently sized. It took me two sittings to eat it and although I was full, I didn't feel sluggish, which is usually my problem with burritos. The chips and guacamole were a great deal for $4. It came with a lot of guacamole and although the chips were a little salty, it was still good. The delivery was around 45 minutes but our food came fresh and warm. Will definitely order from here again!
author: Hana K.

description: Delicious food!! I like my carne asada with no fat and my sopes with carne asada had none! They were perfect and the coca cola in the bottle.... the best. Best prices too
author: Brenda E.

description:
I was looking forward to trying Toma when I noticed their impressive 4.5 stars on yelp, Toma has been calling my name for quite a while now. Being a Mexican food connoisseur, I was not very impressed. 

I ordered a carne asada burrito (which also contains rice, beans, cheese, and pico de gallo) and it was nothing special.  There are definitely better burrito options in the area, albeit I did really like their cantaloupe agua fresca!  They also have a salsa bar, and all of their salsas were extremely watery, which is not preferable.  However, most of them were really tasty!

Bottom line:  If I'm going to eat a carb-heavy burrito, it had better be good!  Sorry TOMA, maybe I will try your tacos or tortas!
author: Juliana K.

description:
So glad Toma is here! My husband and I were so sad when Chilayo closed.  It was our go to Mexican place in our neighborhood.  Yes, there are a lot of other Mexican restaurants in the area, but all are a "scene". And sometimes you just want good, simple food.  Toma is it! They have a small but complete menu with burritos, tacos and quesadillas. They serve the meat eaters and veggie crowds as well, which is important to my husband who is a vegetarian.  He had their mushroom burrito and said it hit the spot.  I had the beef and chicken tacos, which were flavorful.  We also had a side of guacamole which tasted so fresh.  

Anyway, I'm glad they are nearby and can't wait to get my fix again soon!
author: Natalie S.

description:
Toma toma toma!  

My biggest complaint of growing up in sf is sh!%ty Mexican food.  Toma has restored my faith in good Mexican food in sf!  The tacos are to die for, they're made with hand made tortillas made to order, the tomatoes were super fresh and so were the other ingredients.  I had the torta most recently and it was so good I felt compelled to write a review!  Both times I came I was served by Junior who recommended some homemade salsa that really acted as the cherry on top of a five star affordable meal that is so uncommon in San Francisco I can't wait to come back.  Great service!  Great location!  Great experience!  Do yourself a favor and ¡TOMA!
author: Josh R.

description: Stopped by randomly yesterday and had an excellent carne asada burrito.  TOMA is less than a week old, and definitely a significantly better option than Los Hermanos down the block.  The restaurant is quite small, although there is a bit of seating area both inside and outside (weather permitting). Probably best as a take-out option.  The ingredients were very fresh tasting and the staff (owner/manager?) who helped me was very nice.  I'll be back...
author: Andy S.

description: The burritos are huge, tasty and keep you full for hours. Cute little place, ok service.
author: Nina G.

description: I work around the corner and have tried all the Mexican places in the area--by far Toma is always the best. I grew up in so-cal so I'm pretty spoiled with unbeatable mom and pop taquerias at every corner. Toma always has super fresh ingredients, delicious salsa options (love the mild red, would buy by the gallon if possible), and ridiculously tasty marinated and freshly grilled meat! I usually get adobado, but every other meat I've tried is great too. The breakfast burritos are excellent as well. I get the ham and egg breakfast burrito with potatoes, add avocado and drench with the red mild sauce. Mmmmmm
author: Matt N.

description:
We've finally got a legitimate Mexican spot on our side of the city!  We tried the adobado, carne asada, pollo asado and mushroom tacos. All had excellent seasoning, killer soft, tasty corn tortilla and spot on pico de gallo.  We also split an adobado burrito as well and it was on par with the tacos. The tortilla was thin but chewy, which seems under executed at most places.  To top it all off, Izzy, one of the owners, was super polite and inviting. Good stuff. 

Long story short I'm not reaching far when I say that these are some of the best tacos on this side of the city and may keep us from wondering over to Tropisueno!  Hopefully other people taste the difference  between Toma and places like Mamacitas and Tacko and feel the same as we do. Once that happens this place won't Benin their small take out location for long!
author: joe z.

description: We got Toma to cater our work lunch last week and it was a hit! Such good, authentic Mexican food. We'll definitely be asking them to cater again for us!
author: Julia S.

description: Love these tacos!! They make homemade tortillas which are fluffy and delicious. I have gotten the shrimp tacos a few times and absolutely love them. A friend has tried their breakfast burrito and really liked it too. I'm so glad I found this place as I'll be frequently stopping by for a quick dinner when I don't want to cook.
author: Stephanie B.

description:
Sometimes the food is very good. A lot of times however it's way over salted and barely edible, as in tonight.  I usually order burritos, so perhaps the other items are better.

Also, what's the aversion to including salsa in delivery options? When you get Mexican food a reasonable assumption is that you'll receive salsa (not a side of pico de gallo they expect you to pay extra for). I have made specific requests for them to add this and flat out been told it's not possible by the gal on the phone.

Customer service is lacking. 

Advice: reduce the salt, throw in a couple to go salsas, and improve the overall customer service.
author: S T.
