description: The food is so fresh and with a blend of spices make each item just wonderful.  The customer service is  fantastic you are greeted with anhonest smile and a pleasant  greeting from the cashier.  This is the place for that quick Latin dish you've been craving. great job guys!!!
author: John V.

description:
Burritos are gigantic and the basic meats are good (I've tried chicken and pork). Wasn't a huge fan of their barbacoa, which is one of their specials, but their chicken mole (tues special) is to die for. 

Pretty expensive for a burrito with ordinary offerings of rice, beans, meat, and pico. Plus it costs extra to add sour cream and guacamole. But if you're in pac heights/the marina, you're not gonna find much cheaper or a better price-to-food ratio (again, burritos are huge). 

No more than 4 seats indoors and a couple of seats outside. The guy behind the counter who does the lunch shift is really helpful (will offer you samples) and friendly.
author: Tiffany Y.

description:
Very underwhelming burrito that tries to attract its clientele via a nice front and the temptation of quality meat. However, for the price, the amount of food you get and the utter lack of any flavor, I warn people not to come here. Initially, I was brought to this restaurant via yelp, and therefore I want to review on yelp to say that the 4 star reviews are deceiving. I ordered the carne asada burrito with guacamole for $9 (with no free chips) , and after eagerly biting it I was wondering why it was all mush with not much substance. 

The rice, beans, guacamole, meat just all was one being flavorless mush. Thankfully I had a little tapatio from the restaurant, but soon I ran out, and then I was scampering around the house for some ability to give this mush some flavor!!! I only had some sriracha and man that wasn't too satisfying.

No good.
author: Lars B.

description: Some of the best Mexican food I've ever had! On our week-long trip to San Fran, my fiancé and I visited this spot twice!
author: Nora K.

description:
Been wanting to try this newest member if 'the hood'. We are a 4 times a month Los Hermanos people and enjoy the taste of 'Central Valley' Mexican food.....Very important note! 
The service was excellent! Sarah is so sweet, spoke English, and answered a few questions from this newbee....one she did not know was 'what area of Mexico are the cooks from?' Fairly important! 
The chicken burrito was ok and became better with the added salsa. Our son says the quesadilla from Los Hermonas is better. We also got a Sope and beef Taco.  They were good.
Will we return to our favorite spot Los Hermanos? Probably...
I saw they offered chile verde on Thursdays and Posole on weekends, so we may be back to give those a try!
author: Barbara N.

description:
WOOOHOOO! No one does hand made tortillas anymore... made to order too! I'm not a chicken lover, but I did do one chicken taco and it was amazing! Everything is fresh and made to order. With so many food options, fresh gets major points. 

The chick behind me (who also informed me that my zipper was down, props to girl behind me) said the sopes are awesome.

Can't wait to go back!!! Just what the Marina was missing AND it's open late night.
author: Tina P.

description: Never liked this place but supposed to be open late night, tried it on Halloween, closes at 11pm on my way home. Never again
author: Vicky B.

description:
Pros:
Had a burrito, which was great.
Friendly

Cons:
No free chips bums me out
No whole heat tortilla option.
No shredded chicken option.
author: Captain B.

description:
Toma is good. But setting my desire for a small restaurant to succeed and their very friendly service aside, it is JUST good. I think I expected to be a little more wowed based on the fantastic reviews, and I can't say I haven't tasted this before. Yes, it is fresh and not greasy. But is that really impossible to find in California? 

Crunchy, drippy taco enthusiasts...not the joint for you...but that is not what Toma is trying to achieve. I will return, but with my expectations set for tasty, not out-of-this world incredible.
author: Kiesha R.

description:
Nachos, tacos and burritos.... This place absolutely knocks the basics out of the park. Their tortillas are the freshest which makes all the difference in taste/texture.

Absolutely would recommend this to anyone.
author: Adam H.

description:
Handmade corn tortillas (yes, handmade!) - CHECK.
Savory tacos with unique toppings (i.e. mushroom, zucchini) - CHECK.
Fresh salsa bar with 4 tasty, original flavors - CHECK.

Best little joint in the Marina - CHECK, CHECK.
author: Sarath S.

description:
Sorry, I never complain. In fact, it is my practice to only review products and services I enjoy, but this was the worst burrito I have ever eaten. Let me clarify, I could only eat some of it, the rest I fed to the garbage can. 

Let's start with the sauce...no, better yet, forget whatever it is they use as a sauce; I gargled and brushed for a long time after just to remove the unpleasant aftertaste. 

One good thing I can say, the person who took my order was very pleasant: for which I added a 2nd star. 

But all the pleasantries in the world would never entice me to go back.
author: Edwin H.

description: A very solid Mexican restaurant. It's a small restaurant, but very nice and cozy. Chicken tacos are delicious and the freshly made tortillas make them unique. Delicious horchata as well, not too sweet or grainy. Friendly staff.
author: Emma W.

description: The guys who work there are awesome and the service is fast and efficient. Toma is my go-to Mexican restaurant. Their quesadillas are light and not too greasy and their prices are great!
author: Heide B.

description: This used to be my go-to spot for burritos in the Marina. The prices are good, they are usually pretty quick, and the food is great for the price. That being said, NEVER use their online APP. I recently placed an order on their app and it never confirmed that the order went through. As a result I re-ordered on the APP and 30 minutes later a double order arrived at my house at which point I have been charged double tip, double delivery fees, and now have double the food (which I do not want). Despite speaking with 4 different employees about the issue (over the course of 2 weeks) and them all promising me that the manager will call me back (he never called), they have since blamed me for the glitch in their app and refuse to refund the additional $42 worth of charges. I used to be a loyal customer, but after their dismissive and rude responses and refusal to correct the mistake caused by their own app I will not be going back. Luckily there are plenty of alternatives in the neighborhood.
author: Tori P.

description: Really really delicious... I got three tacos- shrimp, barbacoa and carne asada. Jam packed full of flavor. So far in San Fran we are definitely winning on the food scene! Come and check them out!
author: Liana M.

description:
Non-traditional taco's with homemade tortillas that are thicker than the average tortilla at the Mission joints.  Nice fresh ingredients.
Does not replace the Mission taco places but definitely a nice complement.
author: bao t.

description:
Always great to have a new burrito spot in the neighborhood, and that's exactly what toma is. Perfect for burritos on the go, especially if you appreciate a home made tortilla. 

The staff is very friendly and welcoming, but thay didn't really compensate for the boring tacos. I had the mushroom and pork tacos, and they were just ok...a little bland. 

My boyfriend had tue carne asada burrito and it was very good!  We will probably come back for burritos :)
author: Meredith M.

description: I'll always be grateful because these guys very kindly let me and my babysitting charge stay at their outside seating while we were locked out of the house. Super friendly staff and great with kids. Their sopes with champiñones are really great- creamy and well-cooked base and wonderfully seasoned mushrooms, with fresh lettuce. The seven-year-old got seconds of the quesadilla, which is a nice treat.
author: Beatrice W.

description:
A few days back I ordered the barbecoa quesadilla..hands down best quesadilla I ever had! Lots of cheese, lots of meat and lots of flavor! 

A single serving was plenty for me and the people working there seemed to enjoy their job and were very friendly to me.
author: Ders V.

description:
Absolutely. Love. This. Place.

Fresh, tasty and satisfying on every level. While mex has always been a challenge in the marina, this place brings some credibility to the area. And they deliver. Love the tortas, the burritos, and the fresh tortilla made a tacos. Everything is freshly cooked made-to-order and you can tell.

Definitely one of my favorites in the area and worth a stop for at least a taco/small bite, if not dinner.
author: David R.

description: Good food but rude service no thank u there behavior is like take UR shit and go some time keep smile on wonderful faces .0
author: Saketh D.

description:
Overpriced and nothing special.  I should know by now that if I'm paying $30 for two burritos and two beers, I'm in the wrong place. 

Actually, one of the burritos was just rice and beans, and the "beer" was an agua fresca which makes paying that much infuriating. Overall it was ok but we'll be going to Los Hermanos next time we get burrito cravings.
author: Daffodil K.

description: Disgusting, boring, overpriced burritos now.  Over the years a gradual, decline, to blah.
author: Anon A.

description:
Too much.

Wish I was referring to the food. Calabacitas burrito with grilled squash, zucchini, tomatoes and onion was great. Extra black beans. Lettuce instead of cheese.

Flour tortillas are your only option.

Great indeed. But $7.50 great? Not so much.

Other options might be better. All meat comes from Golden Gate Meat Company which certainly justifies a higher price. But for veggies only?

Way too much.
author: Jason B.

description: Wow!! what an amazing place, the food is fresh and cheap, especially for the area. It was clean and the staff was friendly and let me try all the veggie options before I bought my food. I highly reccomand this place :)
author: Christian A.

description: Always a good meal here, and love sitting and talking to whoever is working the register and cooking my food! I'm a vegetarian and I switch it up and my boyfriend swears my there carne asada! It is a small place so very easy to miss off of Steiner, in between a parking garage and Barney's, but trust you do not want to miss it. I have had burritos and chips and guacamole on my lunch breaks but my newest favorite is the bowl featured below with black beans, Guac, and the calabacitas veggie option (both are great by the way), and topped with fresh limes and hot sauce complimentary for customers to grab. If you feel like a big spender, try the Horchata, it's the perfect amount of sweet.
author: Jasmine W.

description: Best carne asada tacos in the area. I lived in Mex for some years and by far this place is the closest when it comes to Mexican food flavor. Fresh and delicious !
author: Creta V.

description:
Just finished up my first trip here. Needed a late lunch to tide myself over until dinner and this hit the spot. 

I had the carne taco and the veggie taco with mushrooms and poblano--both were excellent. I knew they were going to be good upon walking in and seeing they were made to order (the cook is a couple feet behind the counter freshly cooking everything on a flat iron grill as you order). Great flavor, tender carne asada, and nicely marinated mushrooms. 

At $2.95 a taco, its very generously priced considering the quality. Throw in a couple Modelos and outdoor seating on a nice sunny day and you've got an all-around great, affordable Mexican spot. Will definitely be back.
author: Steve B.

description: The food is good.... But service from the Asian girl is horrible. Rude, no eye contact, not even a smile or thank you.
author: Mo B.

description: The freshest, tastiest carne asada nachos I've had in a long time! Plus they have homemade tortillas and horchata?! This little spot is not to be missed. So delicious! I'm going to have to remember they're open until 2:30 am on Friday and Saturday!
author: Amanda W.

description: This is our fave spot in the Marina/Cow Hollow for burritos. Not only is the meat freshly cooked for each order that helps kick up the flavor another notch, but the ingredients are piled high making the burrito size mucho grande. I'm often shocked how expensive these Mexican places in the neighborhood can be (Tacko, Tacolicious, Mamacita, Sabrosa, etc.) but TOMA is the exception. We're also pleased that every person we've met working the register has always been friendly and courteous. The free salsas are also a nice touch. Don't miss out on their breakfast burritos!
author: Ryan E.

description: Super good burritos. And I LOVE burritos. The salsa bar is great. I got the carne asana. Great tender meat. There were a few " gritty, fatty" pieces which is not my favorite. Overall a great place and I have a feeling I'll be having a hankering for them again.
author: Lindsay J.

description: This is the best Mexican food I've found in the Cow Hollow/Marina area. Absolutely amazing. It's not just the tacos. The Fajita burritos are scrumptious. Don't look any further. Try it out. I usually stock on a few burritos and conquer them over the next couple of days. Nice people, too.
author: Tom D.

description:
Great place to go to at night if you got the munchies, but dining in is not recommended; I really don't recall any chairs or tables (correct me if I'm wrong), Price is just right if you order what is on the menu, but when you add basic necessities like; guacamole, sour cream, etc. The bill will add up, and a $8 burrito will end up $187 (exaggeration).    
  The food and the way it is served is decent and unique, meaning; hand made tortilla is fluffy, and is completely different from your typical take out burrito place. Also,  they make and cook everything when ordered, nothing is pre-made. Of course, that comes at  the cost of ridiculously, ridiculously long wait times. 
  Great place to taste the difference, other than that, its just another burrito take out joint that happens to open after last call.
author: Wayne L.

description: I love this place. Everything is fresh and tasty. Ordering online is the best!
author: SF O.

description: Stopped in San Fran for lunch during a long road trip Had pork tacos at the recommendation of the cashier. They were pretty cheap and tasted wonderful! The horchata was also really good!
author: Wendy M.

description:
let me preface by saying the food we got was via a postmates delivery but we were less than a mile away at my buddy's so the delivery time should not have affected the taste.

anyways-big MEHS all around for this place. nothing stood out. carne asada was too chewy and bland. i didnt like tortilla for buritto and just not enough options overall in my opinion.

im a die hard chipotle fan and that place is 100x better. tacko is also better option closeby.

pack one toma
author: Sean K.

description: Got a burrito this time. Usually I like my burritos with no meat (although I am not a vegetarian), and don't usually choose the veggie option either. This time I decided to go with the yellow squash/zucchini/tomato option. It was good, but kind of overpowered the other flavors.
author: Alexandra W.

description: So delish!!! Tortillas are fluffy and fresh, best tacos I've had in SF. Plus the salsa verde, droooool!!
author: Tiffany C.

description: Steak taco was really tasty. Everything else was just OK. The guac had that old taste to it - do not recommend getting a side of it unless maybe early in the day. Felt like it was sitting out a while. Service, however, was lovely.
author: Jeff M.

description: Great chicken Tacos, friendly staff and tasty salsas. Josh at the counter suggested I write a review and attempted to to up sale me a drink, thanks for the grub
author: Carl C.

description: I think they were reading the reviews and made an adjustment.  The portions have gotten much bigger! Im happy to give them 5 stars now
author: Vince C.

description:
I had 2 experiences with Toma, and they were very different. In a neighborhood like the marina, it's nice to have some better mexican options that aren't several times the cost of other neighborhoods in the city. Casual, and more authentic place, more like the mexican you might get in the Mission. 

The first time I walked in and walked out with a stellar, loaded order of nachos with lots of carne asada, great toppings, salsas, etc, etc. Perfecto!

The second time I ordered on the internet for delivery and it was not so great:
-The food arrived cold, and about 30 minutes later than specified.
-The portion was about half of what I had received previously!
-I paid extra for roasted vegetables and got 1-2 mushrooms in one and a piece of squash in the other- seriously guys?
-I asked for no rice and extra lettuce and veggies- clearly no extra veggies, and there was no lettuce whatsoever. 
-I asked for spicy salsas and cilantro, and received none
-Due to minimum order for delivery, I added 4 servings of vegetables, this arrived as about 1 cup of vegetables in a small plastic container
-The delivery fee was extra

Needless to say, I will order in person and never do delivery from here again. The food is good but wow, this online ordering service was a big mistake. C'mon guys, really?
author: J B.

description: This burrito was amazing. Just the right amount of sinus-clearing spicy. And a good deal. 'Twas a delicious and nicely sized burrito indeed. The service was quick and friendly. Definitely going to make this a regular spot on my commute home.
author: Monk F.

description: Good local eatery in the Marina... Fast, cheap, and healthy. U can dine outside or grab ur order to go... Ur walking distance from Marina Village.
author: Leanna P.

description: First of all, I didn't know you had to ask for sour cream and guac separately and pay extra. Most taquerias just automatically put all that stuff in there. Other than that the food was pretty good. 30$ for 2 burritos and 2 drinks. Would come back, just need to read the menu a little clearer.
author: Melissa M.

description: Their burritos are alright but their tacos are good. They're a bit pricey but its bearable.
author: Tina F.

description: Loved this place. The freshest, tastiest food I've had in San Francisco to date. Had a chicken taco with guacamole and sour cream, utterly delishious.....and the watermelon drink was lovely. Highly recommended.
author: Eda K.

description: I usually love this place but the staff is just not dependable when it comes to hours of operation. Rather than being open until 2:30 am as their website, Yelp page, and front door proclaim, they close out potential customers before midnight, denying their patrons the late night Mexican delicacies they deserve. These injustices must be stopped if we are ever to advance as a society. The people must rise up against Their oppressors and take what is rightfully theirs!
author: Kenny B.

description: The food was fresh and didn't feel too heavy like a lot of Mexican food. The portion was a nice size and the price!
author: Heather B.

description: TOMA is a great addition to the neighborhood! Fresh ingredients, friendly customer service (shout-out to Sarah!) and a vibrant menu.  You can really taste the difference with their organic and grass-fed beef.  Awesome spot to grab a quick dinner after work, and bonus points for staying open late. TOMA is at the Top of my list!
author: Sophia R.

description: I ate here for the first time today and it was so good! I got the chicken burrito with black beans. All ingredients seemed super fresh and had authentic seasoning. I will definitely be recommending this place to my coworkers in the Marina and be coming back again very soon! Thanks Toma!
author: Stef S.

description: I was excited to have another quick Mexican spot in the hood as all the other options are not tasty...sadly this one was a miss as well. Ordered a chicken burrito and got food poisoning. Now that's what I call no bueno!!!
author: cassie V.

description: Simply amazing Mexican food. I have frequented TOMA since they moved into the Marina, and have NEVER been let down. Their champinones burrito (mushroom and poblano pepper) is a refreshingly different version of the vegetarian burrito, and is delicious. Their meat selections are always very tender, fresh, and traditionally prepared. Carne asada and chicken mole are two of my favorites. They also serve three different breakfast burritos, which I frequently crave. This place puts to shame many of the infamous Mission District taquerias. Do yourself a favor- stop reading and get over there.
author: Martha D.

description: Great value in the heart of the Marina. Efficiently organized little authentic Mexican food tacqueria. Outdoor seating is nice, mimosa was refreshing, salsa bar was tasty. Service was excellent.
author: Chris S.

description: Small and clean restaurant. Nice and pretty quick service. I've ordered beef and pork tacos which were great! A good place to satisfy cravings at a fair price!
author: Jaclyn N.

description: From the daily, routine spot you can always count on- to the late night authentic taco joint (one of the few that are available late night in sf), I would highly recommend TOMA.
author: Sumner W.

description: Best Mexican food in the Marina! The chicken tacos are unbelievable and the handmade corn tortillas cant be found anywhere else in SF. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone!
author: Sean P.

description:
nasty burrito. where's the chicken? all i see/taste are beans. i want my money back.

angry.
author: Sangita A.

description:
I am a huge Mexican food fan and Toma is my favorite spot in the city.
I've only ever had the sopes, tacos, and burritos, but they always do an excellent job.
The service does take a little longer, but they really do just put that much more effort into the food.
The girl working at the counter was such a doll-she greeted every customer that came in with a smile and was also extremely helpful. My first time there, I wasn't sure what to get.  She recommended the champinones (mushroom) and asada burrito and it was delicious!  
Definitely eat here!
author: Kristen M.

description: Great place for a quick burrito and also if traveling to Papalote is too far on a Sunday night. Toma puts a good amount of meat in their burritos too!!! Will be back!
author: Lauren W.

description: I have no idea how this place has gotten these reviews. One of the worst, flavorless burritos I have had in recent memory. This place won't be open long if they keep producing a burrito of this caliber. They make Los Hermanos look like French Laundry.
author: Jason R.

description: This is the best mexican food in the marina. Ive tried pretty much everything and its all good. Adding fajita and quac makes everything flavorful and amazing!
author: Heather C.

description: I'm going to jump on the wagon and praise TOMA for finally bringing downright delish Mexican food into the Marina. I had the veggie burrito with added carne asada because I can't go on without meat so I was glad to hit all the food groups with my burrito. The carne asada is as good as everyone praises it to be, and I almost want to do just a carne asada without the veggies next time just because I want more steak! You can definitely taste the freshness here! Best part is, 10 bucks can get you a hefty lunch and some change for your meter.
author: annie w.

description: I love love this place. REAL mexican food and its so quick and fresh! The Raja burrito with carne asada is the way to roll. Thanks Toma for being a neighborhood favorite!
author: M Q.

description: I consider myself a mexican food snob and this is downright delicious.
author: Ryan H.

description:
We were visiting SF and came across this place via Yelp reviews. It was so great (cheap fresh delicious homemade type food) that we went totally out of our way the next day just to go back there again! My husband is addicted to burritos and gets them wherever we go. He said that Toma has the best ones he has ever had.

We were visiting SF and came across this place via Yelp reviews. It was so great (cheap fresh delicious homemade type food) that we went totally out of our way the next day just to go back there again! My husband is addicted to burritos and gets them wherever we go. He said that Toma has the best ones he has ever had.
author: Violet F.

description: Toma is a great new spot in the Marina.  We weren't in the mood to travel down to the Mission, but lucky for us Toma provided tasty tacos without the trip across town.  The carne asada was the biggest hit.  Get this!  The meat is perfectly seasoned, literally freshly chopped before your eyes, and sprinkled with fresh pico de gallo.  While the service isn't fast, I truly appreciate the fresh and home-made food.  Note: small interior isn't good for eating in with a group. We'll be back Toma!
author: Kim K.

description:
Based off of a steak burrito served wet:
1. Low grade ground beef
2. Enchilada sauce that was so tangy it made me want to gag. 
3. Nothing but beans and rice. The burrito was 95%beans and rice even though I asked them to go light on both. 
4. For a $9 burrito it's def. not worth it. 
You can get 2 that are twice as good at any Mexican restaurant in the mission.
author: Leroy A.

description: Food here is pretty delicious. Not only are they fast, but also very accurate. I am very picky about having my meat extra well done and absolutely no salsa, and they got it down first time. Forever stopping by whenever I'm craving Mexican on my lunch!
author: Andrew G.

description: Fresh, tasty food and nice staff. I tried the chicken burrito, which was full of meat - no scrimping like at other places. The salsas are nice, too. I recommend this place if you're in the vicinity.
author: C E.

description: Oh my goodness!  This place rocks!  The taste of fresh Mexican that leaves you wanting more!  We will be back Forsure!  If you like hot salsa try the two they have in their salsa bar in the back...so good!
author: Raquel S.

description: My go to spot, I like the mushroom burrito.  A little pricy for what it is.  Would like for them to have a fish taco option.
author: Mike D.

description: Amen. The Marina needs more good, simple Mexican food and this place is #1 in my book now. I love Tacolicious but it is a bit of a scene and this is great if you just want some good food without dealing with a crowd. I got the chicken burrito with an add of sour cream and chips that I used to test out the homemade salsas (the two hot sauces are HOT). The salsa verde was excellent and I added some of the chopped onions to it to make it a little chunkier and more scoopable. Paid approximately $11 for burrito/chips/coke. Not cheap but good value. Everything was incredibly fresh (chicked cooked to order) and the pinto beans were out of this world! I will be coming back here a lot.
author: Robbie K.

description: Not bad at all. I had a lackluster taco here a while back but came back and gave the burrito a try and it was so good I'd have given it an 8.5 but yelp does stars. 4.25 stars!
author: Rob C.

description: You know how hole-in-the-wall places are usually the best when it comes to food? Well, TOMA is no exception! This tiny little Mexican restaurant in the Marina district serves food that is no less than deliciously crafted! Although it may not be the most "authentic" Mexican restaurant, it succeeds because it has created its own unique brand of American-Mexican fusion which is, at best, mouth-wateringly, makes-you-want-to-eat-the-whole-burrito-even-though-you-know-you-shouldn't-kind-of-delicious, and, at worst, a great place to get a burrito at 3am after your bar-hopping spree in the Marina. What I'm saying is... eat TOMA. You won't regret it.
author: Ariana C.

description: After a really fun day at the palace of fine arts, my husband and I, along with family and friends decided to try Toma after seeing a lot of good Yelp reviews. I am so happy we did! The food was so delicious, and the prices reasonable. All of the staff was really nice and accommodating, we will definitely be back. The one caveat I had, was how small the place was. With myself, my husband and 4 other people it was really cramped! In a bigger place, this place will shine!
author: Janell M.

description: Just had a pork taco. Super tasty marinated pork and the made to order tortilla was awesome. Will be back.
author: Aimee L.

description: loved it, finally good mexican food options other than Tacko. Los Hermanos is nothing compared to Toma
author: Robert T.

description: Utterly forgettable tacos. Not one standout feature - spongey, soggy tortillas that fall apart in your hands, fatty chunks of under-seasoned meat (the carne asada), and bland salsas. Do yourself a favor and skip this place in favor of Tacolicious for a far better experience just a block away.
author: Braden S.

description: So excited to have a new burrito place in the Marina! It's delicious. Pollo Asada burrito is the bomb. Great selection of salsas as well!
author: Julie O.

description: we are in love with the queso fundido. Wow!  The handmade corn tortillas are the best I have ever had.
author: Rebecca J.

description: The food is really really solid and the customer service and friendliness of the guys behind the counter make it easy to come back!  Love the carne asada!
author: David P.

description: This place is bomb, the food is fresh and prices are good. The owner's are chill ass dudes. get some tacos.. boomtown
author: Matt D.

description: This place was really good. Their menu isn't that large but the food is very good. It's family owned and its absolutely obvious that they take pride in their food. I would definitely recommend it!
author: Erica C.

description: Went in here on opening day, it was so good, had the best burrito ever! As a vegetarian I found the mushroom and squash mix a delicious and filling option to add to my burrito.  I've been in there a few years ago when it was "lets be frank", was very impressed with the new look and great food.  Definitely looking forward to going back soon.
author: Willow B.

description: I don't get it.  My chicken burrito had chunks of cartilage in it (that sucks) and they barely put any guacamole in it and the guac was already watered down.  And the burrito just didn't taste that good.
author: T. Hardy J.

description: Best Mexican Food in the area! From the homemade tortillas to the great tasting Carne Asada full of flavor! Finally a Mexican restaurant with real authentic taste. Absolutely recommend for anyone.
author: Cordero J.

description: Some of the best Mexican food in SF! Pure and simple, incredible fresh homemade tortillas, and each of the four salsas are phenomenal. The service is excellent and helpful to boot! I recommend a carne asada burrito with mushrooms or the sopas. You can't go wrong at this place.
author: Parker R.

description: TOMA has fantastic tasting Mexican food at a very reasonable price. The place seems very clean and well kept. I regularly stop by and the service is always prompt, friendly and accurate. Highly recommended if you're ever in the Marina and need a quick, affordable and filling meal!
author: Shane B.

description: Delicious Mexican!  Would highly recommend this place - quality ingredients and authentic Mexican food.  The grilled chicken is amazing - great seasoning and nicely grilled.  The barbacoa was amazing!  So juicy but not greasy.  Burritos were wrapped well.  Id pass on making the burrito wet but that's because I'm not the biggest mole sauce fan.  Will definitely go back.
author: KK R.

description: This place is a must do on your dine out list, exceptional customer service, fantastic food and in my opinion the best Burrito in the city. I eat here 3 times a week sometimes 4 and the employees always make sure I'm happy and served fast. They have a large selection of food, which is prepared correctly (not too greasy). The prices are more then fair, you seem to get a lot of food for the money they charge.
author: John M.

description: Nice little place for late night tacos, burritos, and other goodies. High End ingredients and really cheap prices are easy on the taste buds and wallet.
author: Michael L.

description: This place used to be so good.  I guess the bottom line caught up with it because "steak" is now flavorless ground beef.  It is not good.  Quick kidding yourself, Toma.  Bring back high quality meat and I will come back.   So weak.
author: Eric W.

description: I had Toma cater my birthday party at my apartment. Their tacos were AMAZING! Many of my guests texted me the next day asking where they were from. The tortillas are particularly delicious. I was nervous using a Marina Mexican place as I normally go to El Farlito, but I could not be more pleased. Additionally, TOMA was a pleasure to work with and incredibly helpful / friendly. Will definitely use them again!
author: arielle r.

description: I just discovered this great  little whole in the wall on Steiner between Chestnut and Lombard.  The chile colorado was delicious, just like my grandmother's, and hers was the best - full of flavor without being too hot.  Beans and rice were good and the tortillas were amazing - made fresh for each order.The ingredients were of good quality, more like Tacalicious or Mamacitas, just without the fancy setting. Good value.  Tacos were only $2.95 and my full chili colorado dinner was under $10.  This is a new place and when the word gets out there will be a line out the door I bet.
author: Jeanne D.

description: I ordered a chicken burrito with fajita peppers and onions. Burrito was big and soooo delicious, employees were very kind and extremely helpful! Thank you guys!
author: J F.

description: Just moved to SF and discovered this great gem on its opening day while looking for food in the Marina District. Delicious chicken burritos with some unusual flavors (mushrooms!) and a modern restaurant design make this a great place to seek out -- Highly recommended!
author: Eric M.

description: Get the sopes!!!  Best thing I've ever eaten!  Or get anything else it's all equally as good!  They could upgrade their chips but once you try the home made sopes or tortillas you'll forget all about the shitty chips.  Good salsa as well and finally a take out mexi food place in the marina!
author: Scott C.

description: Best burrito outside of the Mission! Delicious home style recipes, fantastic salsas, and solid service. Check these fellas out!
author: Matt D.

description: Place is yummy.. Get the chicken burrito. Fresh ingredients and high quality .. Good place for quick Mexican food in marina
author: L D.

description:
i was a supporter of Toma until they let me down.

i left feeling sick after i ate a beef burrito this week, the meat was tough and fatty. Thats the price i pay for asking and paying for double the meat quantity.

what happened guys, the food here used to be very good.
author: Michael M.

description: Wet Burrito is quite good with freshly grilled chicken and good service.
author: Y U.

description: Such a great new restaurant in the marina. The food is fresh and delicious- i highly recommend the veggie burrito with mushrooms. The owner is super friendly and told me that they will be selling tacos late-night on weekend nights, which is awesome. Definitely worth checking out- I will be returning often!
author: Oscar Q.
